identity.description: The identity of the cluster, if configured.

location.description: The geo-location where the resource lives

properties.description: The cluster properties.

zones.description: The availability zones of the cluster.

clusterResourceId.description: The resource id of the cluster where the databases you would like to attach reside.

databaseName.description: The name of the database which you would like to attach, use * if you want to follow all current and future databases.

capacity.description: The number of instances of the cluster.

principalId.description: The principal ID assigned to the cluster principal. It can be a user email, application ID, or security group name.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the principal

enableDiskEncryption.description: A boolean value that indicates if the cluster's disks are encrypted.

enablePurge.description: A boolean value that indicates if the purge operations are enabled.

enableStreamingIngest.description: A boolean value that indicates if the streaming ingest is enabled.

keyVaultProperties.description: KeyVault properties for the cluster encryption.

languageExtensions.description: List of the cluster's language extensions.

principalId.description: The principal ID assigned to the database principal. It can be a user email, application ID, or security group name.

tenantId.description: The tenant id of the principal

dataFormat.description: The data format of the message. Optionally the data format can be added to each message.

eventHubResourceId.description: The resource ID where the event grid is configured to send events.

mappingRuleName.description: The mapping rule to be used to ingest the data. Optionally the mapping information can be added to each message.

storageAccountResourceId.description: The resource ID of the storage account where the data resides.

tableName.description: The table where the data should be ingested. Optionally the table information can be added to each message.

version.description: The version of the template defined, for instance 1.

hotCachePeriod.description: The time the data should be kept in cache for fast queries in TimeSpan.

softDeletePeriod.description: The time the data should be kept before it stops being accessible to queries in TimeSpan.

enginePublicIpId.description: Engine service's public IP address resource id.
